meanings.definition: To make something into a commercial product or service.
meanings.sent1: She was commercialising her homemade candles by selling them at the local market.
meanings.sent2: The company was commercialising their new software to reach a wider audience.
meanings.sent3: The idea of commercialising her pet rock collection seemed silly at first, but it turned out to be a hit!
meanings.sent4: He had a talent for commercialising even the most mundane items, turning them into sought-after products.
meanings.sent5: The process of commercialising the old family recipe brought it to the attention of many customers.

meanings.definition: To promote or sell something for profit.
meanings.sent1: The marketing team was commercialising the new line of skincare products through social media campaigns.
meanings.sent2: They were commercialising their services by offering discounts to attract more customers.
meanings.sent3: The idea of commercialising a broken toaster as a modern art piece was met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent4: She had a way of commercialising even the most unusual items, turning them into best-sellers.
meanings.sent5: Commercialising the limited edition sneakers created a buzz among sneaker enthusiasts.
